item.title: 法廷資料：Inc.とFast Companyの出版社の人事トップが会社から429Kドル以上を盗んだとされ、2023年4月に解雇、5月1日に逮捕（Max Tani/Semafor)
item.description:
Max Tani / Semafor:
Court docs: the top HR exec at the publisher of Inc. and Fast Company allegedly stole $429K+ from the company; she was fired in April 2023 and arrested on May 1  —  The Scoop  —  The top human resources executive at the publisher of Inc Magazine and Fast Company allegedly stole more than $429,000 …

item.title: ドナルド・トランプがニューヨーク・タイムズと姪のメアリー・トランプを相手取り、彼の納税記録を入手するための「陰湿な陰謀」を主張した訴訟を判事が投げ出す（Lachlan Cartwright/The Daily Beast）。
item.description:
Lachlan Cartwright / The Daily Beast:
A judge tosses out Donald Trump's lawsuit against The New York Times and his niece Mary Trump, in which he alleged an “insidious plot” to obtain his tax records  —  Trump sued the paper, along with his niece Mary, alleging an “insidious plot” to grab his tax records and publish them in a Pulitzer-winning report.

item.title: ダウ・ジョーンズは、ウォール・ストリート・ジャーナル、バロンズ、マーケットウォッチ、インベスターズ・ビジネス・デイリーのコンテンツを含むストリーミング・ラジオ・チャンネルをTuneInで開設する予定です（Matthew Keys/The Desk）。
item.description:
Matthew Keys / The Desk:
Dow Jones plans to launch a streaming radio channel on TuneIn with content from The Wall Street Journal, Barron's, MarketWatch, and Investor's Business Daily  —  The service will offer around-the-clock audio programming from the Wall Street Journal and its sister publications.  —  By: Matthew KeysMay 3, 2023,

item.title: IABのレポート：ソーシャルビデオやコネクテッドTVを含む米国のデジタルビデオ広告費は、2022年に前年比21％増の471億ドル、2023年には17％増の552億ドルになると予測（Karlene Lukovitz/MediaPost）
item.description:
Karlene Lukovitz / MediaPost:
IAB report: US digital video ad spend, including social video and connected TV, rose 21% YoY to $47.1B in 2022 and is projected to rise 17% to $55.2B in 2023  —  U.S. digital video ad spend increased 21% in 2022, to $47.1 billion, and is projected to rise 17% in 2023, to $55.2 billion …

item.title: ストライキを起こしたWGAのライターたちは、自分たちの作品がトレーニングデータとして使われることと、AIが生成した「ずさんな初稿」を直すだけの仕事をさせられるという、AIに関する2つの大きな心配を抱えている（Benj Edwards/Ars Technica）。
item.description:
Benj Edwards / Ars Technica:
Striking WGA writers have two main worries about AI: their work being used as training data and being tasked with just fixing AI-generated “sloppy first drafts”  —  WGA writers don't want to train AI or clean up AI-generated “sloppy first drafts.”

item.title: デトロイト・フリー・プレスは、非営利団体チョークビートの編集長を2年間務めた後、ニコル・アベリー・ニコルズを新しい編集長に任命した（JC Reindl/Detroit Free Press）。
item.description:
JC Reindl / Detroit Free Press:
Detroit Free Press names Nicole Avery Nichols as its new top editor, returning to the outlet after a two-year stint as editor-in-chief of nonprofit Chalkbeat  —  Nicole Avery Nichols, who has reported and edited news in Detroit for more than 25 years, leading coverage that has ranged …

item.title: Sinclair Broadcast Group、第1四半期の売上高は前年同期比40%減の$773M、Diamond Sports Groupと多数のBally Sportsチャンネルの運用難が主因 (Matthew Keys/Fierce Video)
item.description:
Matthew Keys / Fierce Video:
Sinclair Broadcast Group reports Q1 revenue down 40% YoY to $773M, largely due to operational woes at Diamond Sports Group and its many Bally Sports channels  —  Sinclair quarterly earnings Diamond Sports regional sports network (RSN)  —  The bankrupt cluster of regional sports channels operated …

item.title: TikTok、Condé Nast、BuzzFeed、NBCなど一部のパブリッシャーが投稿と一緒に広告を販売し、収益の50%を確保できる「Pulse Premiere」を発表（Alexandra Bruell/Wall Street Journal）
item.description:
Alexandra Bruell / Wall Street Journal:
TikTok announces Pulse Premiere, which lets select publishers, such as Condé Nast, BuzzFeed, and NBC, sell ads alongside their posts and keep 50% of the revenue  —  New product will let publishers sell ads alongside their posts and take home half the revenue

item.title: ハリウッドの脚本家のストライキが長引けば、Netflix、Apple、HBOは、コンテンツをかなり前に作る傾向があるので、他よりも有利な立場になるだろう（Joe Flint/Wall Street Journal)
item.description:
Joe Flint / Wall Street Journal:
If the Hollywood writers' strike drags on, Netflix, Apple, and HBO will be in a better position than others as they tend to make their content far in advance  —  Industry executives point to clauses that let parties sidestep contractual obligations in extraordinary circumstances

item.title: エド・シーランがマーヴィン・ゲイの1973年の名曲「Let's Get It On」をめぐる赤裸々で皮肉な著作権訴訟に敗れたことは、音楽全体に言いようのない影響を与えるだろう（Elizabeth Nelson/Washington Post）。
item.description:
Elizabeth Nelson / Washington Post:
Ed Sheeran losing the nakedly cynical copyright lawsuit over Marvin Gaye's 1973 classic Let's Get It On would have unspeakable ramifications across music  —  Elizabeth Nelson is a singer and songwriter with the D.C.-based band the Paranoid Style.  —  Imagine a painter in their studio, preparing for an exhibition.

item.title: TikTok、刷新されたCreativity Program Betaのクリエイターファンドを、10K以上のフォロワーと過去30日間の100K以上のビューを持つ18歳以上の米国在住のクリエイター全員に開放（Aisha Malik/TechCrunch）
item.description:
Aisha Malik / TechCrunch:
TikTok opens its revamped Creativity Program Beta creator fund to all US-based creators over 18 with over 10K followers and over 100K views in the past 30 days  —  TikTok announced today that it's opening up its revamped creator fund, called the “Creativity Program Beta,” to all eligible creators in the United States.

item.title: ByteDanceは、インド、インドネシア、ブラジルで提供している音楽ストリーミングサービス「Resso」の無料層を5月11日に廃止し、有料層は維持する計画だ（Bloomberg）。
item.description:
Bloomberg:
ByteDance plans to discontinue the free tier of its music streaming service Resso, available in India, Indonesia, and Brazil, on May 11 and keep its paid tier  —  TikTok owner ByteDance Ltd. is scrapping the free tier of Resso, its music streaming service for emerging markets.

item.title: ベラルーシは、2021年5月のライアンエアーのミンスク行き迂回便で逮捕されたベラルーシ人ジャーナリスト、ロマン・プロタセビッチに、さまざまな罪で8年の判決を下す（Caleb Davis/Reuters)
item.description:
Caleb Davis / Reuters:
Belarus sentences Roman Protasevich, the Belarusian journalist arrested on a May 2021 Ryanair flight diverted to Minsk, to eight years on a range of charges  —  A Belarusian journalist who was arrested after being hauled off a Ryanair plane that was forced to land in Minsk almost two years ago …

item.title: RSFは、「フェイクコンテンツ産業」が報道の自由度ランキングの「変動性」を高めているとし、米国は3つ下がって45位、ロシアは9つ下がって164位となった（Bron Maher/Press Gazette）と述べている。
item.description:
Bron Maher / Press Gazette:
RSF says that the “fake content industry” has increased “volatility” in its press freedom rankings; the US fell three spots to 45 and Russia fell nine to 164  —  RSF's secretary-general said this year's index was characterised by “major falls and unprecedented changes”.

item.title: 世界報道の自由度指数2023：31カ国が「非常に深刻な状況」、報告書では最低ランク、より多くの権威主義者が報道を封じる（Oliver Holmes/The Guardian）
item.description:
Oliver Holmes / The Guardian:
World Press Freedom Index 2023: 31 countries are in a “very serious situation”, the lowest ranking in the report, as more authoritarians silence the press  —  World Press Freedom Index report warns disinformation and AI pose mounting threats to journalism
